website_summaries.verdict: A fantastic choice for younger children, this simple slide offers  enjoyable features alongside an affordable price tag.
pros: Includes an overhead sprayer down the middle of the runway
cons: The inflatable sprayer had difficulty staying upright for some customers

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Kids loved it! Great price, still works, fun fun fun
customer_reviews.author: Pamela O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a great water slide. Even expensive ones don’t really last longer than a full summer. I only gave 4 stars because as others have mentioned, the arch isn’t attached to the slide and can fall over. We use a few heavier pool toys to keep it in place, but I would have paid a few more dollars more to have it attached. The little boogie board is awesome and my 5 and 8 year old loved it!
customer_reviews.author: elleem

customer_reviews.title: Water fun!
customer_reviews.text: This item was surprisnlgy good and lots of fun. We bought it for some fun over the 4th of July weekend and this slide stayed up the whole Summer in our backyard. Thanks to the most helpful reviewer that provided instructions about putting water inside the arch. Otherwise, I'd have never known since the instructions were very poor. The sliding board eventually deflated and we had to patch it with the included patching tape but our girls had hours of fun in this slip n slide. We cleaned it and put it away for next Summer!
customer_reviews.author: G's  Mom

customer_reviews.title: My review
customer_reviews.text: The part that hangs over the slide and sprays the water out kept falling over. There wasn't anything to anchor it. Also, in the bottom where the water hose connects, it kept coming loose and water sprayed from the connector. The slide itself and the raft that comes with it were fine. It was fairly easy to blow the parts up with a manual pump (sold separately). Honestly, this was a little more trouble then it was worth but my son got a few hours of fun out if it so far this summer.
customer_reviews.author: ShellBell

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: At $55, this is not worth the cost. I needed something fun for my daughter to do in the backyard, and slip n slides were mostly sold out everywhere. This model is just ok. As other people mention, the archway falls over constantly. That’s where the hose attaches, so you need to use it in order for the slip n slide to work. All the manufacturer would have had to do would be to add weights to the bottom of each side of the arch. Definitely a poor design. If this had been $30, I’d feel better about the purchase. But $55 is a lot for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S.

customer_reviews.title: So poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: The arch that goes over the slip n slide was poorly designed that it fell over and had holes in it within an hour. The long slide with the blow up sides worked well and the kids have enjoyed sliding on it. They should just sell it like that at a third the price, then I would give it a good review
customer_reviews.author: FarmerJoy

customer_reviews.title: The arch doesn't stay up....
customer_reviews.text: The slip n slide is great except that the arch that the water pours out of is not attached to the base and won't stay up. I had to rig up a system with a rope and some anchors in the grass to hold it up, and even that wasn't perfect. There's a review that mentions filling it with water vs air, but i can't figure that one out. We still use it, but I'd rather have paid extra for the arch to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok.
customer_reviews.text: My little one loved it , my oldest didn’t so much. I used cardboard underneath but my kids still got hurt, the top part would keep falling so kids didn’t really use it but they liked getting the slide wet and would try and slide with the water even tried pulling each other or pushing still it was hard - so I wouldn’t recommend buying this...
customer_reviews.author: TefyGarcia

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Brought this slip and slide for my granddaughters that are 1 and 4. Didn’t last one use. I was so upset with it I threw it away instead of returning it back to amazon. Piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Allen

customer_reviews.title: Slip and slide
customer_reviews.text: We used this slip and slide 3 times with my 5 year old granddaughter then the seams began coming apart and wouldn't hold air. Don't waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Momby

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: My grandkids had a ball this summer on the slip and slide. Easy to put together. We put it on a hill and they flew down it. Ages 8 and 12 have a lot of energy. Held up well and will use again next summer.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Fun in the sun!
customer_reviews.text: Kids had a ball! Perfect entertainment for the backyard. Not for kids older than 9. It seems to be pretty short. My 7 year old grandson slides right off every time, has fun anyway!
customer_reviews.author: 711winner

customer_reviews.title: Horrible - Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money! Kids unable to slide, nothing worked. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Julikins

customer_reviews.title: . If you popped a hole in it on driveway  or stick in the grass its your faukt. This is well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a five star product, ignore any negitive reviews. Kids love it. Its 18 dollars, if you pop a hile its probably your own vault ir something in the grass. Its not sn automobile made of steel, i dong expect it to last past one season but it has. Buy a new one next year, if it lasts its a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is having great fun on this! The delivery was prompt.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Leonard, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was awful- very cheaply made- didn’t even last a couple of hours before it broke
customer_reviews.author: msm39

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Niiiiiiiicccccceeeeee! Who needs a pool? Hot days disappear and are replaced with laughs and memories!
customer_reviews.author: Monique Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: This is poorly made and poorly designed. The hose attachment was impossible to secure and the donut hole with the blue plastic curtain looked like an uncomfortable fit for my 2 and 4 yr old grand kids. It was returned as defective.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: cheap and fun
customer_reviews.text: This thing lasted about as long as expected - 2 uses. Should have put a tarp under it. But there were older kids - 6/7 on it as well that were a bit rougher than the 3/4 year olds.
customer_reviews.author: eric l johnson

customer_reviews.title: Boo. Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is SO CHEAP. Water from the tunnel went everywhere BUT down on the slip and slide. We only use the slip and slide part and run a hose or sprinkler on it. Even then the slip and slide is nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old granddaughter couldn’t play in it without collapsing. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn. Rutland

customer_reviews.title: It was really nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren played with it for about three hours the first day I got it. It only works for kid ten and under however so I ordered a really big one also. It was really nice for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jewell i hood

customer_reviews.title: Horrible purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I’d give it a zero if I could. This thing worked for about thirty seconds. Then my 4 year old had a raging meltdown when it stopped working. Don’t waste your time or money. Sending back ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor water fun
customer_reviews.text: Kids had a blast! It is hard to keep the arch upright
customer_reviews.author: DJG

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a slip & slide this is not the one for you. The arch doesn't spray the water in the direction & it's impossible to change it. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: DayLil

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: It was very cheaply made and leaked when we got it. Tried to repair it with the patch that was provided even the patch did not hold, sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: steve clark

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made but works on a hot day
customer_reviews.text: the spray from the arch shoots out at a crooked odd angle so it doesn't really line up with the slide part, but if you angle the arch, you can make it work. We didn't want to spend big bucks for our toddler, so we went with this one. And it works, but it's not exactly high quality and I don't expect it to last forever...
customer_reviews.author: gcCassie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 yr old and on the first use, where the hose gets connected it came off. After that you couldn’t attach it to the blow up part. Not worth buying it
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: Don't wast
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product zero stars I would. The blow up part won't stay up right and it leaks at the hose connection.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Tuffy

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: Great design, durable, easy to set up. An easy 5 stars from me. Better than the original slip and slide.
customer_reviews.author: K&R

customer_reviews.title: Decent fun on the cheap
customer_reviews.text: These things are fun, but you need to set up at least two in a row if you don't want your kids sliding 20 feet past the end. Also, don't expect them to last more than one season.
customer_reviews.author: jimmunology

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very cute slide. My 8 year old had a blast
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much better after we did
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to read the directions about filling the piece that sprays the water! So much better after we did!! :-)
customer_reviews.author: eleanor mcconnell

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The instructions don't tell you to put water in the bottom of the arch to keep it upright, but once we did that we had no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. My 2 1/2 year old could actually slide ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. My 2 1/2 year old could actually slide down to the end when we put the hose in the beginning of the slide. That would be the only improvement I see.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Manaloto

customer_reviews.title: More work..less fun
customer_reviews.text: Garbage...the slightest little breeze blows the tower over. The nozzle leaks immensely where the hose connects.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It would have been a good product if it didn’t have a leak in the base
customer_reviews.text: It came with a leak in the base layer. It would not stay inflated even though I tried three times to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Ross

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. But you need to add detergent to the water to really slide.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: That it was kid friendly
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's just right for my grand kids
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Worked great all day for my 12 year old Son's party
customer_reviews.text: Worked great all day for my 12 year old Son's party. I bought two to put together. One is just not long enough. Good fun:)
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Who doesn't like a slip & slide
customer_reviews.text: Bough as a gift, but haven't given it yet. Who doesn't like a slip & slide? Received on-time.
customer_reviews.author: Shel

customer_reviews.title: It goes everywhere and not onto the slip and slide so pretty pointless.
customer_reviews.text: The part that goes above doesn't spray the water right. It goes everywhere and not onto the slip and slide so pretty pointless .
customer_reviews.author: whitley trotter

customer_reviews.title: Good slide for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good slide for the money. The sprayers at the top required some fiddling in order to spray onto the slide and continued readjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Dkf

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE product. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE product. DO NOT BUY!!!!!! Fell apart after one use, the arch portion NEVER worked correctly before breaking. I just wanted a plain slip n slide that I remember using as a kid, but all I see are these over-the-top pieces of junk that fall apart a minute after using it. TERRIBLE product. I would give it 0 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The water sprayer isn't centered. The water sprays mostly away from the slide.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Tebbs

customer_reviews.title: Best Slip and Slide on the market
customer_reviews.text: We've bought every slip n slide out there over the years, and this one is by far the coolest and best made versions we've tried. My boys are 7 and 9 and they definitely approve. Squirt a little bit of dish soap for some added fun!! I do wish the bottom had more of a pool, but we can always add one at the end as a crash/landing pad. Like one of the other reviewer stated, make sure you add some water to the bottom of the tunnel to make sure it stays up.
customer_reviews.author: Ibuystuff

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I don't quite understand this slip and slide. The water only comes out of the rainbow piece, which isn't anchored to the ground so falls over unless someone holds it straight. So we had one child hold the rainbow with the water that sprays out of a single round hole in the front and back of it. The hose has to be turned low or the water sprays far beyond the slip and slide. And after close to 7 minutes, the slide was abandoned. Wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Bad design. You need to prop the arch up ...
customer_reviews.text: Bad design. You need to prop the arch up with something and even then one sprayer points toward the slide while the other points up in the aid to the right and about 2 feet further than the slide. Yes I tried everything from low pressure to moving it around. No matter what, only 1 sprayer hits the slide and that is if the arch stays standing.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Christianson

customer_reviews.title: Great hit but, one stopped functioning after 2 hours....
customer_reviews.text: Great hits however one just stopped working after 2 hours...no punctures... Just wouldn't work...the kids were disappointed since there were two pieces and the one not working was the only one that hooked up to the hose!
customer_reviews.author: alice

customer_reviews.title: Worst slip slide ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst slip slide ever. Arch is not attached to slide and falls over if not duct taped to slide and then falls over anyway and this is where the water sprays out so you have to use it.connection to hose does not seal lots do leaky wasted water.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy C

customer_reviews.title: Don't even consider it.  Keep on moving.
customer_reviews.text: Don't even waste your time. Broke in under an hour, Didn't come with all the parts as directed. Horrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cilia

customer_reviews.title: Love the concept of this slide and would have been ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept of this slide and would have been great if all the pieces were included (missing the washer for the hose attachment and therefore it leaked) and if it had been put together properly (sprayer in arch was not lined up correctly and didn't spray on slide).
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Osgood

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the raft, LOVE the slip and slide....LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! :) The kids used this a LOT this summer!!! YAY!
customer_reviews.author: R. Glick

customer_reviews.title: I would skip this product.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this arrived damaged so I had to return it right away. My kids were excited to use it so it was quite a disappointment. It was torn at the seams of the runner. I would not exchange for a new one as it was clearly not sturdy...just returned it.
customer_reviews.author: janimalover

customer_reviews.title: Worked good until it tore.
customer_reviews.text: worked good the first time, the second time we set it up it tore while we her filling it with air.
customer_reviews.author: D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: As expected. My kids maybe too young for it ...
customer_reviews.text: As expected. My kids maybe too young for it still (1.5 and 3.5). Will put it away for now and play with it later.
customer_reviews.author: Jh_2161

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received was broken. The tube inside was not connected and instead of spraying water onto the slide it filled with water. The second one sprayed, but the holes did not spray onto the slide. The slide itself is sturdy and long. We used it with a sprinkler and the kids enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Carr

customer_reviews.title: Three stars
customer_reviews.text: The kids had fun on it, but we had to set coolers up on both sides to keep the "arch" standing up.
customer_reviews.author: Kim S.

customer_reviews.title: Broke pretty fast
customer_reviews.text: Fun for a day. The raft split at the seam the first day. The kids claim the slide hurts to use without it
customer_reviews.author: Ouijah

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fun but water ring needs to be tied down
customer_reviews.text: Only problem was the half ring kept falling down. They should have made pins to hold it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addick

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: This was a total waste of money. It NEVER worked. The hose wouldn't stay connected. It just kept popping off as soon as the water was turned on. I wanted to return it , but the box was left outside in the rain and it got ruined so I couldn't. Don't waste your money with this slide. It will not work and is very poorly made!
customer_reviews.author: Mar112

customer_reviews.title: GOOD BUY FOR SUMMER
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy! Easy to setup and tear down. You do have to dry it before putting it away. Make sure you use the stakes to secure it because it does shifts around without it. This can be easily setup by the kids, my 7 year old setup ours just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Selene Lariba

product_meta.title: Slip and Slide Waterslide - Icebreaker Water Slide with Racing Raft and Water Sprayer - Over 16 Ft Long by Jilong
product_meta.description: Slip and Slide Waterslide - Icebreaker Water Slide with Racing Raft - Over 16 Ft Long - Slip and Slide all summer long on this new waterslide. Complete with racing raft and inflatable water sprayer, this unique new summer set hooks up to any garden hose.
feature_bullets: Slip and Slide down this 16+ foot Water ramp alone or on the racer included
Hooks up to any garden hose
Recommended for Ages 4 to whoever will fit inside

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars214 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
